sites.name: Martinitoren (Martini Tower)
sites.description: The tallest church tower in the Netherlands, offering panoramic views of Groningen. Known locally as 'd'Olle Grieze' (the Old Grey One).
sites.seasonal_notes: Tower climb available during opening hours. Check for maintenance periods.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets available at the base of the tower. Limited spots per time slot.

sites.name: Groninger Museum
sites.description: A striking modern museum building housing contemporary art, fashion, and local history exhibitions. The building itself is an architectural masterpiece.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Check for special exhibitions.
sites.booking_tips: Online booking recommended for special exhibitions.

sites.name: Noorderplantsoen
sites.description: A beautiful English-style park in the heart of the city, perfect for walking, cycling, and relaxing. Popular among students and locals.
sites.seasonal_notes: Most beautiful in spring and summer. Popular for festivals.

sites.name: Forum Groningen
sites.description: A modern cultural center featuring a cinema, library, exhibition spaces, and a rooftop terrace with panoramic views.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Check program for events.
sites.booking_tips: Cinema tickets available online. Free entry to library and exhibitions.

sites.name: Prinsentuin
sites.description: A historic Renaissance garden with beautiful flower beds, a maze, and a tea house. Located near the city center.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best during spring and summer. Tea house open seasonally.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed. Tea house has limited seating.

sites.name: Grote Markt
sites.description: The main square of Groningen, surrounded by historic buildings, cafes, and restaurants. Home to the weekly market.
sites.seasonal_notes: Weekly market on Tuesday, Friday, and Saturday. More lively in summer.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed. Many cafes and restaurants around the square.

sites.name: Universiteitsmuseum Groningen
sites.description: Museum showcasing the history of the University of Groningen, with exhibits on science, medicine, and academic life.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Check for special exhibitions.

sites.name: A-Kerk (A-Church)
sites.description: The oldest church in Groningen, dating back to the 13th century. Known for its distinctive architecture and historical significance.
sites.seasonal_notes: Check for services and special events.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed for regular visits.

sites.name: Vismarkt
sites.description: Historical fish market that now hosts a variety of goods. One of the most vibrant markets in the city with local vendors selling fresh produce, flowers, and specialty items.
sites.seasonal_notes: Market days are Tuesday, Friday, and Saturday. Special holiday markets in December.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Arrive early for the best selection.

sites.name: Prinsenhof Gardens
sites.description: Once a 15th-century Franciscan monastery, now featuring beautifully manicured gardens with a romantic atmosphere. Includes a rose garden, herb garden, and historic walkways.
sites.seasonal_notes: Most beautiful from late spring to early autumn. Limited appeal in winter.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed. Connected to the Prinsentuin.

sites.name: Northern Maritime Museum
sites.description: Located in a 16th-century grain warehouse, this museum explores Groningen's maritime history with model ships, navigation instruments, and interactive exhibits.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Special exhibits during summer months.
sites.booking_tips: No advance booking required. Guided tours available by appointment.

sites.name: Nieuwe Kerk
sites.description: A neoclassical church built in the 17th century with impressive acoustics, often hosting concerts and musical events throughout the year.
sites.seasonal_notes: Regular services on Sundays. Concert schedule varies throughout the year.
sites.booking_tips: Check event calendar for concerts. Tickets often required for performances.

sites.name: Stadspark
sites.description: The largest park in Groningen, featuring lakes, wooded areas, and open meadows. Popular for jogging, picnics, and outdoor concerts.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful all year, but especially vibrant in spring and summer. Hosts festivals and concerts seasonally.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed for general access. Events may require tickets.

sites.name: De Oosterpoort
sites.description: Groningen's premier concert venue hosting a wide range of performances from classical music to pop concerts and cultural events.
sites.seasonal_notes: Performance schedule varies throughout the year. Annual Eurosonic Noorderslag festival in January.
sites.booking_tips: Advance booking highly recommended. Check online calendar for upcoming events.

sites.name: Appingedam Hanging Kitchens
sites.description: A short trip from Groningen, these unique 'hanging kitchens' built over the Damsterdiep canal are an architectural marvel showcasing traditional Dutch building techniques.
sites.seasonal_notes: Accessible year-round. Less crowded during weekdays.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed. Consider combining with a day trip to the countryside.

sites.name: Bourtange Star Fort
sites.description: A perfectly preserved 16th-century star-shaped fortress located about an hour from Groningen. This living museum showcases military architecture and village life.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open March to October. Historical reenactments during summer months.
sites.booking_tips: No advance booking required for general admission. Special events may require tickets.

sites.name: DOT Planetarium
sites.description: A modern dome theater offering spectacular astronomy shows, 3D films, and cultural performances under its impressive projection dome.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Show schedule changes seasonally.
sites.booking_tips: Advance booking recommended, especially for weekend shows. Check online schedule.

sites.name: Wadden Sea National Park
sites.description: A UNESCO World Heritage site featuring unique tidal flats. Guided mudflat walking (wadlopen) offers a once-in-a-lifetime experience traversing the seabed at low tide.
sites.seasonal_notes: Guided walks typically available May through September. Completely dependent on tide schedules.
sites.booking_tips: Advance booking essential. Tours fill up months in advance during summer.

sites.name: GRID Graphic Museum
sites.description: An interactive museum dedicated to graphic design, typography, printing, and visual communication. Features workshops and changing exhibitions.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed for general admission. Workshops require advance registration.
